    <div class="anchor" id="Trade25"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-2105427053__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-2105427053__tab0" class="dropdown-text">About HSBC Trade25 </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-2105427053__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="pp_tools_columnControl_13">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_11" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><strong>Can I join HSBC Trade25?</strong><br> <br> You can join HSBC Trade25 if you're aged 18 to 25 and would like to start a new investment journey. At HSBC Trade25, we're committed to help young millennials like you build your wealth and a healthy diversified portfolio. Check out our Trade25 Academy and get to know your way around stock trading.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>How does a joint account work with HSBC Trade25?</strong><br> <br> If you join HSBC Trade25 with a joint investment account, both the principal and secondary account holders will enjoy zero brokerage fees for trading under HKD250,000 every month. All trades made will count towards the principal account holder's trading amount. When the monthly trading amount exceeds HKD250,000, all joint account holders will need to pay the standard brokerage fees for further trades.<br> <br> For example, customer A has a sole investment account and joins HSBC Trade25 using a joint investment account. Customer B is the secondary account holder of the joint account. In this case, all trades made by either one of them holding the joint account will count towards the trading amount of customer A, as well as customer A's trades made under the sole account. Both of them won't need to pay any brokerage fees if the trading amount stays under HKD250,000. Once it reaches HKD250,000, both customers A and B will need to pay the standard brokerage fees for any further trades made under the joint account. Customer A will also need to pay the fees for further trades made under the sole account.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Can I join the HSBC Top Trader Club and HSBC Trade25 at the same time?</strong><br> <br> No, you can't join both the HSBC Top Trader Club and HSBC Trade25 at once. If you're currently in the HSBC Top Trader Club, you have to opt out of it first in order to join HSBC Trade25.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>What happens when I turn 26?</strong></li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are 26 years old or above on 1st January 2024, you can stay opted-in to HSBC Trade25 if you meet the minimum transaction requirement every year from year 2024 onwards.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Illustrative examples:</p>
</div></div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_12" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">5. <strong>Do I need to pay penalty fees if I opt out from HSBC Trade25?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you don't have to pay any penalty fee if you opt out from HSBC Trade25.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">6. <strong>What happens if I opt-out from HSBC Trade25 or cannot stay opted-in to HSBC Trade25?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are no longer a member of HSBC Trade25, you'll need to pay for any trades you make through the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, HSBC HK Easy Invest app and HSBC Online Banking according to our standard tariff. The pricing will be 0.25% on Hong Kong stocks and China A stocks, and USD18 for your first 1,000 shares and USD0.015 for additional shares on US stocks. For more details, please refer to our <a href="/investments/products/stocks/trade25/#product-fact-sheets" target="_self">product factsheets</a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you change your mind, you are welcome to opt back in any time under 25 years old. Your previous trading activities with HSBC Trade25 will still be there, and your trading amount won’t reset. However, you will not be able to rejoin after you turn 26. To continue your investment journey, you can join the HSBC Top Trader Club to enjoy low brokerage fees as low as 0.01% and up to 10% p.a for 1-month HKD time deposits  on your un-invested cash.</p>
</div></div>

        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1304044672__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1304044672__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Fees </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1304044672__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="pp_tools_columnControl_14">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="pp_tools_columnControlColumn_22" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_13" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><strong>Why do I need to pay HKD25 every month?</strong><br> <br> You'll need to pay HKD25 every month to hold or trade stocks with us. With this small fee every month, we'll provide you a convenient and secure stock trading experience, with easy access to Hong Kong and US stocks, and China A shares.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>When do I need to pay the HKD25?</strong><br> <br> You'll need to pay HKD25 every month for each of your accounts which trades or holds stocks with HSBC Trade25 in the 1-month period on or before the 1st of the following month.<br> <br> The fee is due and payable on or before the 20th of the following month on a day determined by HSBC from time to time. If that day falls on the 1st of the month and is not a business day, the fee may be collected on the business day which immediately precedes that day, subject to HSBC's decision. The fee is payable upon closure of accounts where the account is closed before the above payment dates.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Do I need to pay the HKD25 if I don't trade any stocks in a month?</strong><br> <br> You'll need to pay HKD25 every month for either trading or holding stocks with HSBC Trade25. Even when you don't trade any stocks in a month, you'll still be charged HKD25 if you have stock holdings in your account.<br> <br> If you don't trade or hold stocks with HSBC Trade25 within a month, you won't need to pay the HKD25.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Do I need to pay any regulatory fees?</strong><br> <br> Yes, you'll need to pay regulatory fees when trading Hong Kong and US stocks or China A shares.<br> <br> Refer to the product factsheets for Hong Kong and US stocks, and China A shares, and the HSBC Trade25 terms and conditions on our website for more details.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Can I view these regulatory fees on my contract notes?</strong><br> <br> Yes, you can check out regulatory fees on your contract notes via mobile banking or online banking.<br> <br> Refer to the product factsheets for Hong Kong and US stocks, and China A shares on our website for more details.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Are there any hidden fees?</strong><br> <br> By paying just HKD25 every month, you can trade stocks without any hidden platform fees.</li> 
</ol>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="190599069__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="190599069__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Monthly turnover and illustrative example </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="190599069__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="pp_tools_columnControl_15">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="pp_tools_columnControlColumn_23" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="pp_tools_richtext_14" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li><strong>What does my monthly trading amount cover?</strong><br> <br> Your monthly trading amount covers all of your trades across Hong Kong stocks including ETFs, warrants and CBBCs, US stocks and China A shares in a month. Only trades on the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app, HSBC HK Easy Invest app or HSBC Online Banking count.<br> <br> You don't need to pay any brokerage fees when trading as long as your monthly trading amount stays under HKD250,000.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>Are initial public offering (IPO) subscriptions, Stocks Monthly Investment Plan (SMIP) transactions and margin trading counted towards my trading amount?</strong><br> <br> No, your trading amount of each month doesn't include IPO and SMIP transactions, and the investments made via HSBC's Securities Margin Trading Service.<br> <br> </li> 
 <li><strong>What if I trade more than HKD250,000 in a month?</strong><br> You'll need to pay standard brokerage fees. Please refer to the <a href="#product-fact-sheets" data-pid="PWS_HK_EN_C69734_5"><span aria-hidden="true">product factsheets</span><span class="visuallyhidden">product factsheets  </span></a> for Trade25 for details. You can keep track of your trading amount of each month on the Trade25 home page on the HSBC HK Easy Invest app which refreshes at least every 15 minutes.</li> 
</ol>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM M-BSCTBL-RW-RBWM" role="region"><div data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="pp_tools_basicTable_5" class="table-wrapper
            ">
    
    
        
        <table class="desktop">
            <caption>
                
    
    
    

















                
    
    
    














<div class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        Here is an illustrative example:

    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">All transactions in US stocks and China A shares are converted to HKD, equivalent to their respective currencies.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">4.<strong> Is my trading amount reset each month?</strong><br> <br> Yes, your trading amount is reset to zero on the first day of each month. If you opt out of HSBC Trade25 and opt back in later in the same month, your monthly trading amount will be the same as when you opted out.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">5.<strong> If I trade on the last day of a month, does it count towards my trading amount of that month or the following month?</strong><br> <br> We count your trades at the time when your orders are executed. If you successfully execute a trade order on the last day of a month, it counts towards the trading amount of that month.</p>
</div></div>
